Title: Adnoc issues early EPC notice for Ruwais LNG, to take FID this year
Description: UAE’s state-owned ADNOC has issued a limited notice to proceed with early engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) activities to a joint venture led by France’s Technip Energies for its planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG plant in Al Ruwais.
Author: JS

Title: Sonatrach announces completion of new LNG jetty at Skikda plant
Description: A large-scale LNG tanker has successfully moored the 4.5 mtpa Skikda LNG plant’s new jetty in Algeria, part of an expansion plan for the facility to accept larger LNG vessels and to expand its LNG capabilities and reach.
Author: JS

Title: Gate LNG terminal weighs construction of the fourth receiving jetty
Description: The Gate LNG terminal in the Netherlands is exploring market demand via a non-binding call for expressionS of interest in small-scale ship loading services for a fourth jetty at the import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade targets FID for Rio Grande LNG’s Train 4 in second-half 2024
Description: U.S. project developer NextDecade expects to greenlight the fourth liquefaction train that is part of the second phase of development of its Rio Grande LNG project in Texas in the second half of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Production issues at Malaysia’s MLNG 2 project at Bintulu spur LNG cargo deferrals
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export complex in Malaysia is facing production issues at one of its liquefaction trains, forcing the operator to seek the deferral of a few term cargoes.
Author: CK
